data.title: >>> DOES THE JOB
data.body:
> MUSIC QUALITY – The sound-quality of music using the Sony MDREX15LP is very good – with typical earbud base. That’s just a matter of physics, earbud drivers are simply to small to produce good base. ("Base boosted" earbuds produce louder base (which smothers the high- and mid-tones), but "loud" (lacking any detail) is not the same thing as "good"). Suggestion, use the earbuds when you are out, but purchase a Sony ZX headphone set for listening to music at home -- and enjoy the base.
> VOICE QUALITY – Clean, clear and crisp in the voice-range, without fiddling with an equalizer – largely because the base is poor. So these (or similar) earbuds are clearly the choice for listening to audiobooks, podcasts, talking on your phone, etc. Listening to music, with base-rich music, can be very enjoyable -- but Sony ZX headphones produce far better base than any brand of earbuds, at any price.
> Loud vs efficient. Sony MDREX15LP earbuds are very efficient --- the volume is loud at low volume settings -- not TOO loud, there is plenty of room for adjustment, but louder than many other earbuds and louder than most headsets, at the same volume settings. Practically speaking, "efficient" means that the earbuds do not drain the battery on your battery-operated device as quickly. "Efficient" is a good thing. Also, if you pay attention, you can usually lower the volume, and the sound quality will be just as good -- and your battery will last longer. Always play music at the lowest setting that you can hear well. Or you can crank up the volume and plan on being deaf by the time you are 50 --- 40 if you use garbage "base-boosted" earbuds.
> EXERCISE, ETC – Stays in place better than most earbuds. But, if you engage in strenuous exercise, consider Panasonic ErgoFit, which fit deeper in your ear. The down side of the Panasonic ErgoFit is that they fit so securely that it is difficult to get them out of your ear quickly, to answer a phone, etc.
> SYMMETRY – The Sony MDREX15L are close to being bilaterally symmetrical – It doesn’t really matter if you put the put the left earbud in your right ear, etc. However, the Panasonic ErgoFit are not, they fit deeper into the ear, and are shaped differently to match your right and left ear canals. It can take a while to get used to inserting the right Ergofit earbud into your right ear, and the left into the left.
> ISOLATION – All truly in-the-ear earbuds, with cup-shaped rubber cushions, are good at reducing outside noise, better than headphones – often good enough for air travel (depending on the aircraft and the location of your seat). Many earbud brands claim to feature “noise cancellation” but do not actually have any noise cancellation circuitry. Passive isolation (such as provided by the Sony MDREX15LP earbuds), is NOT noise cancellation. Feedback reduction (on wi-fi earbuds with microphones) is often called noise cancellation, but isn't. Beware that while true noise cancellation works moderately well for aircraft engines (and similar sounds), it doesn’t work at all for screaming children or random noise. If your earbuds feel loose in your ear, you may need to install large cushions on the earbuds, to get them to seal in your ear canal good enough to provide good isolation.
> COMFORT – The secret to comfort when using earbuds is to use the smallest cushions which work for you. Three sets, small, medium, and large are included with the Sony MDREX15LP earbuds. You might be most comfortable with smaller cushions. It a can also take a while to build up tolerance. So, if earbuds hurt your ears, build up slowly wearing them a little longer each day. It can take weeks to get to the point that you can wear them all day long without pain. Changing, or replacing, earbud cushions is easy -- just pull the cushion off, and push the new one (or cleaned one) back on.
> PLUG – The plug is angled, at 90 degrees, unfortunately. If you pull on the cord, you won't easily pull the plug out the socket, but you will put on strain on the cord (where the cord attaches to the plug), and potential damage it. In my experience, this is how most headphones fail.
> PACKAGING – The Sony MDREX15LP earbuds that I purchased came in wonderful frustration–free packaging — in a small plastic bag in a small easy-to-open cardboard box. But, I can’t promise that you won’t get a horrible retail anti-theft pack. Amzn used to promote and feature frustration-free packaging -- but, sadly, doesn't anymore.
> SLEEPING – The Sony MDREX15L don’t stick out as far as some other brands, and so, may be more comfortable when resting with your head to the side (or inside a helmet). Panasonic ErgoFit fit deeper in the ear, and are a little more comfortable in such situations. APTEK offers a nice earbud set for sleeping that is even smaller–but the cushion is built-in, so you can’t choose the cushion size. However, even with the APTEKs, I cannot comfortably sleep with an earbud in the ear that is on the pillow. My solution – I just use one earbud in the ear that is NOT on the pillow. In fact, I recycle earbud sets where one earbud has failed, by cutting the failed earbud off, and using the working earbud, shifting the earbud from ear to ear if I change sides.
> TIP – CLEANING EARBUDS – The build up of earwax is a serious problem. It can actually muffle and distort or block the sound, and when it gets that bad, effective cleaning is difficult or impossible. The best and simplest strategy is to take a look at your earbuds every few days, and vigorously scratch/flick the open hole of the cushion several times. That breaks loose the wax into flakes, which you can then just blow away. Wiping (such as with a Q-tip) doesn’t work so well (unless you take the cushions off, clean them, and reinstall them), because wiping with a Q-tip may just grind wax into the little screen in front of the speakers, which is then impossible to clean. Caveat, Sony MDREX15L earbud cup-cushions are a slightly different shape from other brands, with a smaller hole, and seems to collect less earwax -- even so, regularly checking and clearing earwax is a good thing to do.

data.title: Excellent, Economic Earphones
data.body: These earphones are very economical and come with 3 different sizes of seals that fit into your ear. They block outside sound quite well. The sound quality is fine for watching online movies, videos and (for me) music. Note that I'm not an audiophile and not very picky about sound quality.

data.title: Good for price
data.body: Decent audio. Below average build. Straight plug would have been better over 90°, though it has its benefits.

data.title: Exactly what we needed
data.body:
These earbuds are perfect for airplane movie viewing! They are so comfortable - even for long haul flights! I have very small ears, so those hard earphones leave my ears so sore after a 30-45 minutes of use.
I love that these have different earbud sizes to choose from. The sound quality seems good for my needs and the different colors are fun for kids to choose from and make it so you don't mix up all the earbuds.

data.title: Great Earbuds!
data.body: This is the sixth pair I've ordered over the years, and I highly recommend. They are not expensive, but they work great and really are sturdy. My son prefers these over more expensive earbuds.

data.title: You get what you pay for. $7 for about a month and a half of use.
data.body:
Bought these headphones for gym use and to listen with my Roku remote. They worked fine and were pretty good at noise canceling for earbuds.

Ordered in mid-October and by December 7th, the right earbud was dying. I thought I was losing my hearing in that ear, but thankfully it was just the cheap headphones.

$7 is a deal, but you may want to buy 2-3 pairs or even setup an Amazon subscription for them because they are a poorly made stopgap more than anything else.

data.title: Fine for my purpose
data.body:
These are just fine for use with my laptop. They don't cancel out ambient noise but I don't need them to. They fit well in my ear and are comfortable for extended wear. They came with different size cups (?) to swap out for a better fit if you need it.
I'm not exacting about sound quality. I want to watch YouTube videos and not disturb anyone else in the room. I don't want them to hurt my ears. That's my critera and as such they're doing a great job.

data.title: Just a standard, good pair of wired earbuds, at a good price.
data.body:
Just a standard, good pair of wired earbuds, at a good price.
They work well for the price, and I'd gladly buy another 2 or more pairs for backups/travel just because of that. No advanced features or anything like that, but if you have a headphone jack and these, then it's perfectly fine. Good product for the price overall, very happy with my purchase.

data.title: Best Budget Earbuds
data.body: I believe these are the best budget (sub $20 earbuds) that I've come across in the last decade. There is a slight level of tuning toward low frequencies which I like over a totally flat response. The cords don't tangle easily and this works with my android mobile phone, and my cd player.

data.title: Good for what you Pay
data.body: These are good for the premium that you pay, but not much more to brag about. Cleaner profile but awfully flat- no lower end, mids aren't bad, highs are also very flat. Good for podcasts or a substitute if you don't want to wear nice headphones/earbuds on a public train. But again, you're getting what you pay for.

data.title: Would Buy Again
data.body: I wear these at night to go to sleep. These headphones do a great job canceling the TV noise and they have good sound quality for the price. I have been using these every night for the last 4 months.

data.title: Good enough
data.body: These are good enough for the price. Not the most comfortable fit

data.title: Simple and adequate.
data.body: They're good for the price. Light, small size ought to stay put during most activities. I found the tapered shape hard to grip with the fingers, and telling right from left requires better eyes than I have. Also there's no volume control or case. But they do what they're designed for and are inexpensive. Durabily? Stopped using them after a year, so for how they're holding up, you'll have to ask somebody in Texas where I lost them.

data.title: Quality
data.body: I have tried many brands of wired earbuds. I like these most for listening to music. They are the most durable brand I have used. The microphone is good.

data.title: Micro Sim Works Great with my Cell Company
data.body: Works great to listen to my pod casts.

data.title: Sony earbuds for a great price.
data.body: This review is for the Sony MDREX15LP earbuds. They are lightweight, inexpensive, and have a good, neutral, sound. I wish the cable was longer and sturdier, but it's hard to beat the price.

data.title: Great headphones for the price
data.body: I bought these to wear at my desk at work. They're great. The only disappointment is the styling of the cable. The cable looks like the cheapie version with the two visible wires. I was hoping for a better look with the one round cable from the plug to where the wires split to the buds.

data.title: Like them
data.body: These ear phones work well and they are comfortable and I like the color and length that they are.

data.title: Very Comfortable
data.body: Great sound quality and extremely comfortable.

data.title: Good price
data.body: The quality is good. And the price point is definitely a value. Works for PS4. Mic built in. Mic quality is clear and static free.

data.title: Used for gaming
data.body: I use these to hear footsteps in apex lol. They work well had them for over a year.

data.title: Good for old school devices
data.body: I got these to use with my old walkman because the new ones have the mic and the connection is different. The wire seems thin but so far so good

data.title: Use caution.
data.body: For work to pass the time while I'm drudging through projects. Typically I use just one ear piece but since I just got them used both to check them out. Co-worker snuck up on me and scared the $%&* out of me. So that's a check on the noise cancelling. Sound was ok, the ear pieces feel well made. I have some hesitation on the sturdiness of the wire but for the price it seems really good. Just use caution if you work with jerks.

data.title: Perfect
data.body: Very well

data.title: Works well
data.body: Comes with different sized ear pieces, very nice.

data.title: For the price, these are pretty nice
data.body: The sound is good, the bass is even half decent. The one star down is for packaging, which I guess is more of a "modern world problem" than anything with the product itself. Anyway, they were in a bag, which was in a box, which was in a second box, which was in a bag, which was in a second bag. Yes, they did arrive safely.

data.title: Basic Headphone
data.body: This is a very basic wired headphone. It's for my laptop. It serves my purpose well enough.

data.title: surprisingly good for ten dollar earbuds.
data.body: they are of sony quality so that’s to be expected. thankfully they haven’t broken after ~20 days of use

data.title: They're good but they do not last long at all
data.body: I have bought like 10 of these earbuds over the past 3 years, they're great for what I want them for but I'm starting to get really sick and tired of having to keep buying more because they keep going out. I take very good care of them and have always had the same issue one ear goes out first after a few months of use, then the next one follows after. I use these earbuds daily so maybe for casual use they would last a lot longer but I think I'm done buying these and will just try to find a better-lasting pair. But hey, for the price you buy them at on sale, they're perfectly reasonable.

data.title: fairly durable
data.body: Using it daily. Cord is very skinny but hasn't broke yet

data.title: awesome
data.body: awesome sound Sony MDREX15LP

data.title: Great earbuds for price
data.body: Sound quality is good for the price point, great for music. Its good for some minor noise isolation. I'm a fan for the wired buds. It's alright for long term wear but your ears will feel the fatigue at some point.

data.title: Great cheap headphones
data.body: Solid headphones, sound great. They're very comfortable, I can hardly tell they're in my ear. However they do tangle easily, but i just keep them laid out to prevent that. No buttons on the wire, not too big of an inconvenience for me though.

data.title: Love these wired headphones.
data.body: I love these little Sony earbuds. I used to look for these at a brick and morter retailer and pay almost twice as much. I used to use them on my cell phone but recent upgrades have left me without a port. I use these with my Kindle. Sound quality is excellent. Great bass and I watch and listen to both EDM and Metal. I have also been able to do a pretty good job of not tiething them up in knots. They produce better sound than any wireless headphone I have in my collection.

data.title: Nice cheap option
data.body: For the price point its hard to wrong. Both kids get a new set to start off the school year and havent had an issue yet

data.title: Alright.
data.body: Bought these quite a few times. Not very durable, but had good sound quality for the price point.

data.title: Not as good as I wanted
data.body: These earbuds come up short compared to some others I have used. They are not quite comfortable in the ears, the hard plastic part actually scratches a little. There is more noise transfer from the cord rubbing on clothing that is really desirable. And they do not seem to be especially durable either.

data.title: Excellent sound
data.body: High quality product just what Sony is known for!🙂

data.title: They work good
data.body: They do the job and they are priced low

data.title: Sony's warranty is not honored - Do Not Buy
data.body:
These earbuds are actually not bad. They're good and typically, for me, they lasted for about 3 - 6 month's before they would have some problem or I would lose them. Well this time they broke and I figured, these have a warranty, why don't I use it. Sure these things are only about ten bucks or so but over the years I've bought at least ten of these. That cost adds up.
So, I called Sony to make a warranty claim. The person I talked to was polite and professional. She told me that I could get a replacement after I sent in my broken set and uploaded a copy of the receipt. She said as soon as they received my uploaded copy of my receipt, they would send me a shipping label.
So after hanging up the phone with her, I checked my email and there was an email from Sony Service and Support. It had my case number and a link to follow to upload my receipt. Well, I tried to upload my receipt and it failed repeatedly. The website responded "Error - no file attached" or something to that effect.
A week later I get a message:
"Thank you for contacting Sony regarding the warranty of your MDREX15AP/W. Unfortunately, we did not receive the proof of purchase and therefore, your case has expired."

Sadly, this is not the first time Sony has let me down. Many years ago I had a professional DVCAM camera I used for shooting various things and the CCD went out while I was in the middle of a job. I shipped it to Sony to have it repaired and when I got it back I made the mistake of not verifying the work had been correctly. This camera went on the self for a few months and when I needed to use it, it couldn't hold focus. I called Sony and they said I waited to long to call them about this issue. The repair was not under warranty. So I paid several hundred dollars for a repair that wasn't done right on a camera that I paid $8,000 for. I'm done with Sony.

data.title: Sticky/slimy goo
data.body: Item arrived covered in a clear, sticky goo. Not sure what it is. Inside package seemed ok.

data.title: For the price
data.body: been buying for years. Rough on headphones so I buy the cheaper name brands. Light so don't fall out of ear as often. will continue to buy.

data.title: Good buy Good price
data.body: They're good quality, light weight and sound pretty good for their size

data.title: Cheap but works
data.body:
I bought a brand new iPhone 13, and shocked when I came home & found out that it had neither a charger or headphones 😳😵‍💫 C’mon apple!!!! So I ordered these cheapies bc I needed something quick, I used an adapter that I already had from another set of headphones so I could plug into Apple. It works 🤷‍♀️ Don’t expect high quality here but after using them for a month they are much better than the off brand more expensive ones (in the 20-30ish $$ range). How long they’ll last idk, but if you don’t like wireless headphones (for limiting Wi-Fi in your head) these can do. Just don’t expect to actually use the phone feature. It’s awful LOL, it’ll make you feel like you’re trying to make a call from like 2006 😂

Bottom line…don’t expect a 200$ pair of headphones. Don’t buy them for the phone feature. But if you need a cheap temp pair of wired headphones these will do the job, much better than others in the lower price range.

data.title: Good quality, good price
data.body: Just a basic, good set of earbuds. I really appreciated the choice of silicone tips as I find most to bee to big and uncomfortable. An overall solid product, no frills, and just what I needed.

data.title: Perfect for planes
data.body: These are super comfortable and have pretty good noise blocking. They were able to block out a good portion of plane noise because they fit so well. Come with multiple size options. Highly recommend

data.title: Check with mic or without mic
data.body: Just a buyer beware. These earphones have 2 options with mic or without mic. I unfortunately bought the wrong ones. The quality is perfect, but I cannot make calls with them.

data.title: Sound is pretty good
data.body: I have small ear canals and couldn’t keep them from falling out of my ears even with the smallest foam pieces installed. They sounded pretty good when they were in though.

data.title: Perfect!
data.body: If you are looking for earbuds for small ear canals, with good sound, these are the ones. I have bought so many pairs over the years looking for that perfect combination. Some are small but sound awful. Some sound good but wont fit. These are just right. They are comfortable for side sleepers. And you can't beat the price.

data.title: Good wired earbuds
data.body: Good sound, use at the gym

data.title: Bang for a buck. Its value is beyond amazing!
data.body: Never in my life I would have said Sony products with great value for its price. This one is the ultimate value one. Just amazing. IT does not have noise cancel or all those features, but it just gets your job done greatly, with dependable quality. If you found this when your old one broke, good for you. This one will get your job done.

data.title: amazing for price and basic necessity
data.body: second time buying these for my PS5. wuality of the mic idk but for a basic everyday use for cheap, these are so worth it. good basic essential

data.title: Worth its weight in quarters
data.body:
Normally I would have a negative option, cause headphones like these tend to break when they get caught on something... but interestingly enough, these seem to hold up pretty well.

I've had these get caught on a table corner, a nail, the fridge door, and a few other objects, and rather than snapping, they held up really well.

So, let's go over the sound and comfort.

For sound, they seem to be very good handling both LOUD and QUIET sounds, including music and noise. Obviously, like every other pair of headphones, they do have a loudness limit, but this limit seems to be past 100 volume for MOST music (except metal).

As for comfort, I mean... not gonna lie, but I actually have fallen asleep few times with these in my ears. They're insanely comfortable and even make for a great noise reduction tool when stuff around you is loud.

All and all, a 5 ★ product, would buy again if I needed to.

data.title: Very good sound!
data.body: These wired earbuds keep my old Sony Walkman working great.

data.title: You get what you pay for.
data.body: Sound quality is ok, no bass whatsoever so when you're listening to music there's no umf.

data.title: So far so good!
data.body: Needed these as a replacement for some genuine Samsung AKGs that got stolen from me. They don't have volume control, but that doesn't really matter for me. I'm no audiophile, but they sound fine, in my opinion.

data.title: Needs something to keep from tangling
data.body: I thought that the order showed a plastic piece to wrap cord around on. Would be helpful to keep it from tangling.

data.title: I keep coming back to this brand
data.body:
Anytime I need a new pair of earbuds, I come back to this brand. For the price, you get good quality sound and a decent lifespan. I think my most recent pair lasted me 4ish years(?)

Of course, I don't exactly treat them like gold since they're the cheap-y kind lol But I guess I can attest to their durability. They can withstand being tossed around and tangled up

data.title: Seemed The Same As Airline EarBuds To Me
data.body:
I bought these "on sale" in late 2023 ($7, marked down from $15). They're fine, I suppose...

...but difficult for me to distinguish from the free ones they hand out on an airplane.

Which are largely disposable.

I'm not sure what warrants these costing $15 (full price)...

...but if you're going on a flight anytime soon, you might want to wait!

data.title: Super value good sound
data.body: Very good ( its Sony ! ) quality sound/ bass for that price especially..worth it

data.title: Great Quality Headphones, Just Not Good On The Road.
data.body:
After my Sony MDR-AS210 head phones were destroyed in an unfortunate laundry accident (sad), I went on Amazon to reorder more of my favorite headphones. But for whatever reason (maybe the marching of time leaving me behind) the product doesn't exist anymore, or/and I have to buy them used for way more than $12. So looking around, I found these headphones, and I figured I would give them a go (only $8 at the time of this review).

Pro's:
Very small and easy to carry around.
The sound quality is highly amazing!
It's just has a headphone jack and doesn't run on batteries (as God intended).

Con's
The ear buds take some work to put into your ears canals.
They slip out of your ears easily.
The headphones rubber coating transfer every sound the wires hit (like the wires skidding on my metal zipper on my coat or on my backpack), and thus can be annoying.

While the engineering on these headphones are quite amazing and they look really good, the practicability of them is some what limited. I would wear these headphones for running, excising, walking, and going about my day. And I just find myself fussing with them more than my old MDR-AS210, which had a rubber loop that gripped my ears (and were more comfortable).

While these headphone would be great for sitting and working on a project (and still a great low price for headphones), I wouldn't recommend for listening to your tunes and podcasts on the go.

Instead spend a little more money (or go on eBay for the other headphones) on headphones that won't be these fussy.

data.title: My go to earbuds!!!!
data.body: They are extremely good quality for such an accessible price! My current pair has lasted over a year and the sound quality is still excellent 👌 They're not the most high end, but if you're looking for earphones to casually listen to music then these I highly recommend. I'm no expert in sound quality, but these definitely seem above average when compared to my previous experiences with earphones. Highly recommend!!!!

data.title: Great value for good comfortable headphones
data.body: Great price and comfortable in your ears. No sound quality lost, no shorting in the wires when being rotated or pulled out. Good quality product

data.title: My Go-To Earbuds
data.body:
They fit my small ears. They sound great. AND they cancel out background noise.

They are inexpensive, so you expect the quality to be bad, but nope! Not these earbuds. I am super sensitive to sound quality, and also to earbuds in general. Most of them hurt my small ear canals, but these are SO comfortable.

Get these, they are worth it.

data.title: budget all purpose beatup truck.
data.body:
After more than a year of constant abuse, my first pair dead on one side. It started having connection issue and I need to wiggle the wire sometimes. But it has been through like A LOT. I think it was at least been washed and dried like 2 times. fully soaked in coffee and tea. A couple times of dropping from 10ft. My sweaty head in the hot sun and gym. Got tangled and caught in different things then got yanked out with blunt force.

Overall its great.

data.title: Great Headphones for the Price
data.body:
Pros
-Well balanced audio
-Variety of Colors
-Lightweight
-Cable does not tangle
-Durable
Cons
-Design is plain
-Earbuds might be too small
Should You Buy:YES
Actual Value:$20

As a high school student (and college), I tend to listen to music almost anywhere I go. But almost all the time, I end up destroying them or losing them. Headphones usually suffer a lot of abuse wherever I use them. However, these earbuds are perfect for college students on a budget who want the best balance of audio and build quality.

-Design-
There isn’t anything particularly interesting of these earbuds. The design is plain, but functional. On a positive note, it does come in a variety of colors to chose from, The cable has a line texture that helps it from tangling up. Everything else also feels durable and it doesn’t look like it’ll fail anytime soon. Overall, it’s more of a conservative look rather than a boring look.

-Performance-
The audio quality is balanced. There is an even amount of bass and treble and it doesn’t feel like one overpowers the other. It has excellent clarity and most music sounds balanced and good, although bass might not be enough if your playlist consist mostly of rap and rock. Overall, it’s a good compromise and good quality music. I don’t usually use the mic, but it does hold up well and it does get my voice clear during a phone call.

-Quality
These earbuds really hold up well with the abuse I typically have with them. I’ve had these for 2 months and I have an older pair for a year and they still sound and look great. This really is the best if you want cheap headphones that will not break easily.

-Conclusion-
Overall, these headphones are my top pick if I need to buy some for exercising or commuting. The audio quality is good and balanced as well and being reliable. I would consider the Skullcandy Ink’d 2 as strong competition, but based on my past experience, they don’t last and will break soon. JVC Gumy are also reliable and have a unique design, but the audio quality is slightly under the Sony. Overall, when it comes down to my money, I’d rather spend it on these headphones. They are simply that good.

data.title: Need an adapter
data.body: The connector does not work with my Samsung phone. It only works with a connector. I wished I had known that when I ordered it 😕

data.title: Not top quality, but absolutely worth the price!
data.body: I use them every morning for my work zoom meeting. They have held up well. Mic is good. They don't hurt the ears. They don't cancel out all of the office noise.

data.title: Perfectly Fine and that's it.
data.body: If you need a really cheap pair of earbuds and you dont care too much, go ahead and get these. They are a perfect backup or emergency pair. If you have a few more bucks, I would recommend anything else if you want something that actually cancels out noise, or provides a good listen.

data.title: Made my ears very itchy and gave me a rash.
data.body: The sound is decent. Eveyr time i wear them my outer ear gets very itchy and i get a rash. No other headphones did this so idk :(

data.title: Comfortable fit
data.body: The Sony MDREX15LP In-Ear Earbud Headphones have been a fantastic addition for my 14-year-old's middle school classes. They offer a comfortable fit, which is crucial for long hours of use. These headphones provide clear sound quality, allowing my child to stay focused on lessons without distractions. The compact design is perfect for young students, and they're easy to carry around. Overall, a great choice for school, ensuring both comfort and audio quality!

data.title: Clear sound
data.body: I needed this purchase to use for my work laptop for team calls, the mic, etc. They get the job done.

data.title: Comfortable
data.body: Comfortable, good quality, and sounds great!

data.title: Uncomfortable and sound terrible
data.body:
Do yourself a favor and buy yourself ice cream or a Starbucks coffee or something instead of buying these. That would be so much more worth your change instead of buying these.

These are terrible. Wearing them for even just minutes makes my ears hurt, and the sound coming from them sounds like a layer of plastic is stuck between my ears and the earbuds. I even gaslit myself and tried all the different sized earbud tips they provided to see if that would change anything (as if that was even possibly a reason). This might be a reasonable purchase if you needed earphones if you were traveling for a week or so, but not for extended use in front of your computer setup or anything like that.

I figured Sony's brand and the 4-star rating was guarantee enough but these are earphones are dirt cheap meant to be built at cents per unit and sold slowly to just passively accrue revenue. Sometimes actually great products have a low price tag, but these earphones are NOT one such product. Please ignore the 5-star reviews that have only ever used the complimentary earphones you get from flying on an airplane.

data.title: Great
data.body: The air buds work great for its price.

data.title: Great SONY Earbuds
data.body: Love it. The sound is so clear to listen to my 1920s-1930s music in my MP3 player ... and that is music !

data.title: Good sound
data.body: Like the comfort and quality of sound

data.title: I enjoy when I am busy, .
data.body: It does what it made for

data.title: good ear buds
data.body: The ear buds usually last me almost year and have decent sound for the price.

data.title: Fairly good sound overall, but quieter than most, and terrible bass.
data.body: The sound quality is very detailed, especially mid-range and maybe higher frequencies, but the bass is practically non-existent, or at least too quiet to matter. At high volume, it comes out some, but it is grossly overpowered by the other frequencies, so maybe the input signal equalization could be adjusted, but it shouldn't be so off-kilter with raw input. They are very quiet in general and require a higher volume setting than most headphones. Decent for the low price I paid though.

data.title: Decently priced and good sounding earbuds
data.body: I got the earbuds with mic. For the price it produces excellent music with a decent bass. You won't be disappointed with the purchase.

data.title: Almost the same
data.body:
I had a pair of Sony earbuds that I bought a few years ago, after my dog chewed up the previous pair. I specifically look for the Sony earbuds for their small in-ear profile, since I generally use them for listening to stuff while I lay in bed, and sometimes I roll onto my side. They tend to be small enough that they don't hurt my ears when I roll on my side, as much as other larger ear buds tent to do. They also seem to have pretty good passive noise cancellation, as long as you have the right sized cap on the earbuds to fit into your ear properly.

I bought this pair because my last replacement pair lost the right connection at some point. I finally got around to replacing those and bought these. They aren't the same EXACT ones as my last, as those are discontinued, but these are pretty close. I might have to put a different sized cap on the buds, as the ones that came on seem a bit too big maybe. It's a tight fit, maybe too tight, and I don't get a good enough seal to block as much noise as the previous pair. Even still, they do block some noise, so I'm happy with them. And the sound quality is just as good as I would expect.

data.title: Won’t Last Forever but Very Inexpensive
data.body: I have to wear earbuds to play white noise like rain sounds in order to sleep. I simply am unable to sleep without it. I can’t use a machine to play aloud as it has the opposite effect on my wife. I have literally went through many dozens of earbuds throughout the years and the main reason is breakage, almost always a short at either the plug connection or one of the earbud connection. I normally have a spare ready to go when that happens and order another backup when it does. I have tried every type and brand and even the supposedly toughest and most expensive will eventually break. I ultimately decided that my best option was a fair sounding, not necessarily the best sounding, fairly well made but not so expensive earbuds would be my best option. At the price for these earbuds I can certainly justify chunking a broken pair in the trash without feeling so bad about it. As long as these are available they are my choice. If you are like me in this regard then I recommend them.

data.title: Good sound quality - Lasted me NINE MONTHS
data.body: Good pair of earbuds. Used them for school and music. The sound quality is good. No buzzing in the ear. They broke after nine months, but that's not too bad considering they were a $7 dollar pair of earbuds. I recommend.

data.title: Great price for a good quality earbuds
data.body:
I'm very particular with sound quality. I tested these with 8D, 24D, an 32D songs and I'm impressed. This model offers great and clear sound. It's not the best quality earbuds but it's great enough for the price. I can compare the sound quality to the samsung or apple earbuds but these are better in terms of comfort in your ears.

Just make sure to use the right size of earpads for your ears. These need to be snug fit and shoudn't have air gaps when you wear them.

data.title: for the price there ok
data.body: needed headphones for my pc since i dont have headphones and for the price there ok for cheap headphone

data.title: Expected quality for the price
data.body: Expected quality for the price. You cant beat 6 bucks delivered. And way way better than any dollar store crap.

data.title: Great for kids at school
data.body: I got these for my son to use at school. They work great! I’ve bought a few pairs (not because they’ve stopped working but because my kid keeps loosing them)

data.title: Earbuds
data.body: I bought these for my daughter for school. She just throws them in her book bag so they are durable and she hasn’t complained about issues with sound. Great earbuds.

data.title: Good Sound
data.body: Would prefer a bit more bass but overall good sounding headphones. I use them for traveling to work and for vacation as pairing to Bluetooth can sometimes be a pain. Old school wired headphones work best on planes, trains and buses.

data.title: Works great
data.body: Perfect price

data.title: very impressive
data.body:
Of course, wireless earbuds are cool and convenient, but for the price, these earbuds are very impressive.
I was super impressed with the noise cancellation. The music sounds great. I hesitated at first because I have always had trouble keeping earbuds in my ears. In fact, the pair that I have used for years has the loop behind the ear to hold them in place. The soft (gummy) part that actually goes in your ear holds them perfectly in place. The even come with two other sizes that can be switched out if need be. The option to take a call is also a nice feature. Very satisfied!

data.title: Sound great, long cord, no cord wrap
data.body: I had a pair of these back in the day and loved them. My favorite feature was the rubber cord wrap that would easily attach to the cord while in use without getting in the way. I specifically sought out this model because the picture showed the cord wrap. Unfortunately, it was not in the box. Maybe this is a cost cut from Sony, but I am very disappointed about it.

data.title: Poor quality. Will not last
data.body: I had a previous pair of Sony headphones that finally stopped working after many years. I loved them. When I bought these to replace them (same color, brand, and style), I immediately noticed that the quality is no longer there. The plastic is cheaper, lighter, and harder. After less than a year, one side stopped working. I'm just so disappointed.

data.title: LOVE!
data.body: They're exactly like the photo. The price is fitting!! U get great quality for a good price. :)

data.body: They not as loud asni thought I got louder headphones for cheaper
